Description: Thin rectangular plaque in hippopotomus ivory, possibly a fragment of a box or vessel; polished surface, but no decoration; fragmentary and slightly worn.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: Material identified by François Popin in April 2007. See SCE IV/1D, pp. 459-557 for LC ivory objects; the date can only be deduced from the associated LCIIC-IIIA objects.
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 80, Tomb 89 no. 9)
